RAINDROP aims to address in a unique way the challenge of building, deploying, and operating applications on upcoming cloud infrastructures formed of a continuum of core (data centers) and edge resources.

Project RAINDROP from UCLouvain and UNamur

RAINDROP aims to address in a unique way the challenge of building, deploying, and operating applications on upcoming cloud infrastructures formed of a continuum of core (data centers) and edge resources. Read more.

Latest news

Middleware 2023

11 Dec 2023

Carole and Yinan presented their works at Middleware 2023 in Bologna

On December 12, 2023, Carole and Yinan presented their works at the 2023 International Middleware Conference in Bologna (Italy).

The papers presented are Towards the Automatic Adaptation of Stateful Microservices Applications across Edge and Cloud and Better Orchestration for SLO-Oriented Cross-site Microservices in Multi-tenant Cloud/Edge Continuum.

SIESTA 2023

11 Sep 2023

Maxime presented his works at SIESTA 2023 in Lugano

On September 11, 2023, Maxime presented his works at the 2023 International Software Engineering Summer School in Lugano (Switzerland).

VLDB 2023

28 Aug 2023

Maxime presented his works at VLDB 2023 in Vancouver

On August 26, 2023, Maxime presented his works at the 2023 International Conference on Very Large Databases in Vancouver (Canada) in the PhD Workshop track.

The paper presented is Automated Database Schema Evolution in Microservices

VLDB 2023

05 Dec 2022

The team at JCE 2022 in Paris

Doctoral students took part in the Journées Cloud/Edge 2022 in Paris (France) organized by IMT Télécom SudParis and IMT Télécom Paris on December 5 and 6, 2022.

Kick-off

04 Sep 2022

Kick-off in Namur

The teams met in Namur on September 4, 2022, to launch the project.
